fields.description:
!image-2018-01-08-14-01-19-541.png|thumbnail! 
Currently, both logos/icons look exactly the same. I actually need to hover the icon on *each page* to know which one is restricted or not. 
Considering that the editing restrictions aren't inherited, we also need to check each one, one by one. 
Of course, the "restricted pages" feature in "content tool" provides a good overview, but I'd prefer to have this info when I land on a page.
fields.summary: Differenciate logo for "no restrictions" and "restricted editing"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently you must set only one due date per task in Confluence, but  if you have several tasks due on the same day, it would be neater to organize them under a single date.

Similar to CONFSERVER-26786 - Support for assigning a task to multiple users

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to organize tasks under a single date
fields.summary: Ability to set one due date for multiple tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the [Contributors Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/contributors-macro-183468956.html] it's possible to display {{watches}}. That is, any users who are currently watching the page.

Unfortunately, this includes users who have selected "watch all pages in this space". It is not possible to see which users have specifically chosen to watch that page, rather than the entire space.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a way to narrow down the users who specifically watched the page as opposed to the entire set of pages in the space.
fields.summary: Ability to display watches for individual page

* Make sure file encoding/Locale of the OS is set as UTF-8

{code} 2. Create another page where in have Chart macro and inside that macro use include macro and use the above created page. 3. When you load the page getting the below error for the chart macro page. Error rendering macro 'chart' : image == null! Please find the attached log which we are getting while getting the above error. Cache [Future Macro]: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.cache/server/overview\\|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.cache/server/overview/] Table Plus Macro : [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.table/cloud/overview\\|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.table/cloud/overview/] h2. Cause The underlying exception is an XML Parsing Exception. For example: Error rendering macro 'chart' : org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 36 of document : The prefix "ac" for element "ac:link" is not bound. Nested exception: The prefix "ac" for element "ac:link" is not bound. In this case it is because the Future Macro is returning storage format inside the chart macro and it causes the Chart Macro's XML Parser to fail. This error could also happen with any other improperly-structure HTML or XML inside the chart macro.
fields.summary: Chart macro can fail due to XML parsing exceptions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Colour text cannot be copied from Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft OneNote and pasted into Confluence.

!Colour bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy colour text from MS Word, Excel or OneNote.
# Paste into Confluence Editor.

h3. Expected Results
Colours are copied across

h3. Actual Results
Colours are not copied across
 
h3.Workaround
Use other text editor as a intermediate landing page between the two applications. 
# Copy colour text from MS Word, Excel or OneNote.
# Paste it into a web based editor like Google Docs or respective software.
# Paste into Confluence Editor. All colouring is preserved.
fields.summary: Cannot copy colour text from MS Word, Excel or OneNote and Paste in Confluence

fields.description:
Bug found while upgrading EAC: After an index recovery, the edge index is corrupted. To fix, we need to do a shut down, and then remove the edge index to let it rebuild again.

Happens on at least one (of four) nodes each time the index is recovered.

 

Note: Broken edge index has symptom of no Popular Content
fields.summary: Broken edge index after an index recovery

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sometimes, when creating Jira issues from highlighted text on a page, the Jira issue will be created but will not be linked on the page. Instead an error is displayed. This will only happen if creating multiple Jira issues (but one at a time).

h3. Environment
* MySQL (5.6 and 5.7)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an application link between Confluence and Jira (I tested with 7.3.1)
# Create a page with text
# Highlight some text
# Create a Jira issue
# Repeat 3 and 4

h3. Expected Results
Confluence will successfully create Jira issues and add them as Jira Issue Macro elements to the page

h3. Actual Results
Randomly, but only after more than 1 issues have been added to the page Confluence will create the Jira issue but fail to add the Jira Issue Macro element to the page. On Confluence 6.1.x it will display a message:
 !cant-be-added.png|thumbnail! 

On Confluence 6.5 and above it won't show the message, but the you will see that Jira Issue macro elements are not added to the page. See the following image that is missing TEST-22:
 !conf-66.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* This only occurs when Confluence attempts to reload the page automatically.

h3.Solution / Workaround
Manually refresh Confluence pages after creating Jira issues from highlighted text.
fields.summary: Creating Jira Issues from highlight fails to update the page and shows a 'These can't be added to the page because you were viewing an outdated version of this page' on MySQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The information pane that appears the first time you attempt to create a Jira issue from highlighted text in Confluence always displays, even if you close the info window. The Show Me button fails to work, and just closes the info window.

h3. Environment
* MySQL 5.6 and 5.7 
* Application link configured to Jira (tested with Jira 7.3.1)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page that contains text
# Highlight any text on the page
# Click the create Jira issue button
# Close the resulting information pane
# Refresh the page
# Highlight any text on the page
# Click the create Jira issue button

h3. Expected Results
The create Jira issue form is shown

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When doing document imports, duplicate titles are not renamed correctly even if the 'rename duplicate' option has been selected. 
The problem appears when the subsequent import that is already in the space, Confluence instead of renaming the title, it overwrites the existing title with the same name. And afterward, the pages behave like a mirror, clicking on the existing title will link to the newly imported page. 

h3. Environment

Confluence 6.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1- Open a page from the 3 dots in the page choose Import to Word document
2- Choose file to import
3- Import Word Document: Configuration
4- Where to Import: Import as a new page in the current space
   Title Conflict: Rename imported pages if page name already exists
   Split by Heading: Lebe1 Headings
   Choose Import

5- Warning showing You are about to create the following page: choose Continue   
NB: To be able to reproduce make sure in Configure Office Connector Plugin
Import From Word: The option: Warnings: Show a warning before allowing a user to perform an import is ticked as per screenshot !warning setting.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

We should be seeing two different Page tree sequence in the child pages as attached screenshot
!expected result.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

When customers choose to Replace existing pages with imported pages of the same title to resolve title conflicts, Confluence overwrites the existing page with new content but also "move" it from its existing parent to a new one.
!current result.png|thumbnail!   
[^video.webm] 
h3.Workaround

Disable the show warning option and not choose to: Replace existing pages with imported pages of the same title
fields.summary: Rename duplicate page in one space not respecting options

fields.description:
Please provide REST API to update confluence Space Category.
Currently there is no REST API to update Space Category.

We have REST API to update Labels and if we update the Label using a content ID of a page it actually updates the Category as a Label, but actually it does not update the table in confluence database.

Post data to update Category Label-
https://<confluence-url>/rest/api/content/19540293/label

[
 {
 "prefix": "team",
 "name": "test"
 }
]

This updates category but when you check the space in the category it does not list the space here-
http://<confluence-url>/spacedirectory/view.action?selectedSpaceCategory=test

 

workaround-

use CLI plugin command to update the category-

./confluence.bat --action addLabels --space  "<Space name>" --labels "team:<Category name>"

fields.description:
+*Description:*+

When undergoing a fresh install of Confluence 6.4 and above and attempting to configure a Oracle 12C DB via the installer, the installer will throw a DatabaseVerifyException when conducting DB connection checks stating that the DB user does not contain the correct privileges. 

Yet, using the same DB user, with the same permissions on 6.3 works fine. No privilege error is thrown.  
 Upgrading does not encounter this as no DB connection checks occur during the upgrade path.
 Tested on ojdbc7 & ojdbc8 drivers using RC1.

Issue is consistent on 6.4+ regardless of oracle DB engine, driver & instance. 

Conclusion being that the DB connection tests do not check for the correct permissions.

Tests need to be more granular to ensure they are covering the required permissions needed to write and successfully configure a Oracle 12c DB for Confluence Server. 

 

+*Steps to reproduce:*+
 # Have a Oracle 12c R1 DB
 # Grant a user dba access & connect, resource role
 # Run 6.4 + installer
 # Configure DB credentials and test connection
 # Observe error

 

+*Expected Outcome:*+

DB connection checks check for correct permissions and allow user to successfully configured db and proceed to the next screen.

 

+*Actual Outcome:*+

DB checks are looking for the wrong privelges and therefore throw an error. See attached.

+*Workaround:*+

Either:

a) Conduct installation via upgrade path

Or 

b) Log into the db, apply the permissions that the checks are looking for and then test connection to satisfy the installer.
fields.summary: Permission Privilege Error when configuring Oracle 12c DB

fields.description: !Capture1288.PNG!
fields.summary: Dead link

fields.description:
Community customer [Problem Connecting Confluence to JIRA for User Management|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Problem-Connecting-Confluence-to-JIRA-for-User-Management/qaq-p/698127] makes this suggestion:

I do think, from a UI perspective, it's odd that Save and Test is disabled until after hitting the Test button. Both because Save and Test appears "before" (to the left) of "Test" and because it includes the word "Test" it's not at all obvious that it's necessary to hit the "Test" button before the "Save and Test" button becomes active. By the wording and position of the buttons, I had assumed that "Save and Test" was necessary to update the values on the page, and that you could then also run "Test" on the saved values at any time without having to save any changes. I suggest changing the wording and/or positioning of these buttons to make it clearer that it's actually necessary to Test BEFORE it's possible to Save and Test.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If one user is editing a Page and another user adds a Gliffy diagram to the page with the *Copy Gliffy Diagram* option *to an existing page* context the page crashes out and encounters 400 bad request errors whenever attempting to apply an update from a chrome browser

h3. Environment
* Discovered on EAC (Confluence 6.7.0)
* Chrome Version 63.0.3239.84 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User A enters edit mode on a page
# User B on an alternate page containing a Gliffy Diagram selects the *Copy Diagram* option
# User B added diagram to *Existing Page* and selects the page user A is editing
# Save

h3. Expected Results
Gliffy Diagram is added to the page

h3. Actual Results
* User A encounters timeout error on screen
* The Gliphy diagram is applied to the page
* Entering edit mode the Gliphy diagram dissapears and shows 400 errors in javascript console
* Applying any update to the page 302 errors occur and updates time out
* Cannot revert changes on the page or the same 302 issue occurs

 
h3. Notes
This does not happen in firefox, and issue can be bypassed using the alternate browser but Chrome will continue to encounter errors

h3.Workaround
[Solution relates to Gliphy Troubleshooting page | https://support.gliffy.com/hc/en-us/articles/217895948-Disappearing-Shapes-and-Lines-Chrome-Browser-]
* As User B
** Navigate to *"chrome://flags"* in a chrome browser 
** Disable 2D canvas hardware acceleration
** Flush Browser cache
** Restart chrome
* Navigate back to the edited page
* Edit the page and make any change
* Update the page

Gilffy diagram is removed but other users in chrome can now apply edits to the page without encountering the error, re-add the diagram and you can then re-enable the 2d acceleration option in chrome.
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing Error with Gliffy diagrams In Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The result of full search isn't necessarily a superset of quick search. 
 Sometimes full search doesn't return items that has been hit as a candidates at the quick search.

For example, here is the step to reproduce. 
 # Create a page with a name "ABCDEF".
 # On the quick search, type "ABC"
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-28 at 13.20.01.png|thumbnail!
 # Click "search for 'ABC'" on the dropdown
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-28 at 13.20.27.png|thumbnail!

As above, this quick search returns "ABCDEF" while full search doesn't.
h3. Suggested Solution

In the example above, expected behavior should be any of the following.
 * Both quick and full search result contains the "ABCDEF".
 or
 * Both quick and full search result doesn't contain the "ABCDEF".
 or
 * Full search returns the "ABCDEF" while quick search doesn't.

To achieve the requirement above, three possible solutions are suggested.
 * Let quick search access to lucene with same condition as full search.
 or
 * Tune the full search (lucene) to cover the quick search result.
 or
 * Tune the quick search to limit the result not to return the items that shall not be contained in full search.

h3. Why this is important

Because it's not intuitive. 
 In many cases quick search is used first to enter full search, so it looks like the search result was lost in the full search.
h3. Note

In the example above, appending an asterisk in the query like "ABC*" enables full search to return the "ABCDEF".
 (Please note this doesn't cover all search query string.)
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-28 at 13.20.48.png|thumbnail! 
 This is based on the specification of CQL.
 [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/performing-text-searches-using-cql/]
h3. Note 2

The definitions of the quick and full search are in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html]
fields.summary: Result of full search should always contain candidates of quick search
Upgrade tomcat to 8.0.48

fields.description:
As a administrator, I want to be able to deploy Confluence in my environment in a fully automated way. 
h3.*Problem Definition*
Currently, Confluence only supports the automated install of binaries. When setting up the database connection and other setup options, the administrator is forced to interact with the UI.
h3.*Suggested Solution*
Enable Confluence to have a scripted installation which grabs the necessary information for the setup from a "setup.txt" file and avoids interaction with the UI while setting up the instance.
h3.*Why This Is Important*
In environments where the redeployment or deployment of new services is constant, administrators lose a considerable amount of time when deploying instances.  
h3.*Workaround*
None
fields.summary: Confluence Fully Automated Setup

fields.description:

We should also support the "OR" operator when it comes to using multiple labels rather than just "AND".

This can help users to configure the filters that they want easily and make the macro more flexible.
fields.summary: "OR" operator support for multiple labels in Livesearch Macro

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When editing a page that has a shortcut link inserted, saving the page will break any shortcut links. There are multiple behaviors:
 # If the shortcut link has a Default Alias, then that text will be changed to the current page title and the link will be to the current page
 # If the shortcut link has custom text, then it will remain, but the link will point to the current page.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a Confluence instance with Collaborative Editing enabled
 # Create a Shortcut Link and give it a default alias:
 !shortcuts.jpg|thumbnail! 
 _(In this example, I created the 'DuckDuckGo' shortcut)_
 # Create a page, and insert 2 shortcut links:
 ## This link should be to google (or any other link without a Default Alias)
 ## The next link should be to a shortcut with a Default Alias.
 # Save the Page.
 # All links will be displayed correctly, and be to the correct URL
 # Edit the page again, and click 'Save'

h2. Expected Behavior

The links will remain as they were before
h2. Observed Behavior

Both links will now point to the current Confluence page. The link text without a default alias will still be correct, while the link text with the default alias will now show the current page title:
 !after_edit.jpg|thumbnail!

h2. Workaround
Disable Collaborative Editing.  Editing a page with shortcut links will no longer break them.
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing breaks Link Shortcuts

fields.description:
The space activity charts gives an impression of popular content, overall view count, and prolific editors; however, the problem is that much of this information is not useful from a knowledge management perspective.
 * Without context, page edits only says how many times a specific user clicked save. Users could make minor edits to a page multiple times and appear to be a greater contributor than they actual are. *It would be useful to know how many unique pages that a single person updated at the Space activity level.* Doing this could also help determine the average effort applied to space content month after month.
 * View statistics can be useless when you have people who create and manage content. They can artificially inflate some of these values by hundreds of pages a day; however, since they are not the primary audience for the space, you don't actually get a sense of the user view stats. *It would be useful to be able to exclude specific users from impacting content views and or Popular content.* By excluding specific power users, teams can gain a better understanding of actual user content / space views, and popular content would actually represent "popular" content.
fields.summary: Prevent specific users from impacting Space Activity Charts

 # Notice that a link is made and no attachment is added
 # Now copy + paste it in the same page or another

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
 - Confluence doesn't keep the link reference and it becomes an attachment.

h3. Workaround
 - Use the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] to copy+paste in the page source.
fields.summary: The link created when inserting files and images from another page is missing after a copy+paste

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you insert an unicode character in the Jira issue filter, Confluence will fail to retrieve the issues from Jira. This happens after publishing the page, but it doesn't happen when you preview the page.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira and create a new project called "Não"
# Go to Confluence and insert a JIM with the following filter:
{code}
project = Não
{code}
# Preview the page.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence will display all issues from the project "Não" as it happens on preview.

h3. Actual Results
The following message will appear:
{noformat}
Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in Jira.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
 !screenshot.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h2. Summary of Issue

Many translations in the latest language pack are garbled. We also found that such strings are garbled on [translations.atlassian.com|https://translations.atlassian.com/] as well.

As far as we noticed, 178 Japanese translations are garbled at lesat and all of them contains one of the representative garbled characters "ã". ("ã" is never used as a Japanese character.) 
 The following query returns the list of the affected translations. 
 [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/translate#/0/0/All Groups/ALL/%C3%A3]
 
!Screen Shot 2017-12-20 at 17.12.49.png|thumbnail!
h2. Environment
Followings are the detail of affected version.
 * 121 translations that are translated on 26 and 27 October 2017
 affect the Confluence 6.5.x and later.
 * 57 translations that are translated on 20 and 27 and 28 November 2017
 affect the Confluence 6.6.x and later.


h2. How to reproduce
Please note this is just one example of the 178 translations mentioned above.

# Install Confluence 6.6.0 that holds Japanese language pack version 6.6.0.m28-v2r28314-2017-11-28. 
# Login to the Confluence.
# Change the language setting to non-english. (In this example, to Japanese) 
# Mouse-over the quick search. 

h2. Expected Result
 It shows  "クイック検索 / または g, g". 

h2. Actual Result
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-20 at 18.26.17.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Notes
* This can affect JIRA Core, Stash, Bitbucket as well since some translations are shared.
!image-2017-12-20-17-57-27-593.png|thumbnail!


* This is applicable to the other non-english language as well as Japanese.
Following is a result of the same search above in Chinese.
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-20 at 18.36.27.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Many translations to Japanese are garbled

fields.description:
h5. Summary
Team Calendar throw WARNING in {{atlassian-confluence.log}} while adding or editing an event:

While adding/editing All Day Event:
{code}
2017-12-18 15:53:09,985 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date 
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: ffafa4c5a68de505 | userName: admin
{code}

While adding/editing event with time:
{code}
2017-12-18 15:53:46,301 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-6] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date  time 08:00
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: 3cb2299b6804c2c6 | userName: admin
{code}

h5. Environment
Team Calendar 5.3.20

h5. How to Replicate
# Install fresh Confluence 6.5.0 with Team Calendar 5.3.20

# Set TimeZone to your own local timezone (double check if TimeZone is the same in user profile settings)

2017-12-18 15:53:09,985 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date 
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: ffafa4c5a68de505 | userName: admin

This is the same as [CONFSERVER-53188 - Some Team Calendar notifications aren't set with a date parse error|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-53188]. In CONFSERVER-53188, it was found that notifications were not sent were expected as they are not sent to the creator of an event.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Even though the TTL of OAuth access token seems to be set as 157680000000 (5 years) by default on Confluence, [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-and-revoke-oauth-access-tokens-208961965.html] said it is set as 7 days.

{quote}
Expires On:
The date when the OAuth access token expires. This is seven days after the 'Issued On' date. When this date is reached, the access token will be automatically removed from this list.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution

The incorrect statement about TTL should be revised.
fields.summary: Documentation about TTL of OAuth access token
New Oracle database setup instructions are unclear

fields.description:
Currently, there's no option to export or import User Macros. If users would like to migrate their user macros, they would have to extract the content from the database and import it back in Confluence. 

This could cause problems to the instance in case there's something wrong with the query. 

Having an option to export the macros would be faster and safer, allowing our users to copy User Macros from one instance to another, not requiring them to manually create the macros all the time they change instances.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After exporting a space and re-importing it, all of the existing Page Properties Report macros (PPRM) will lose the references set at the "With parent" field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the following page structure in a space
{panel}
* Parent Page
** Child page 1
** Child page 2
* Page with PPRM
{panel}
# Enter "Child page 1" and add a Page Properties macro (PPM) with a few properties. Add the label "L1" to this page.
# Go to "Child page 2", add another PPM and set the same "L1" label to it.
# Go to "Page with PPRM" and add a PPRM.
** Label: L1
** In space: Current space
** Click "Add filter"
** Find the "With parent" filter
** Select the "Parent Page" to add it to the filter
# Click "Save" and "Publish"
# Export the space to XML
# Import the space to another instance OR delete the space and re-import it from the XML file.

h3. Expected Results

The "Page with PPRM" should be loading the entries as before.

h3. Actual Results

No entries are loaded. While on Edit mode, the PPRM shows the former page's ID greyed out in the "With parent" field.

 !pprm_bug.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

The issue occurs because there's no way to guarantee that the importing process will re-create the pages with the same ID as when they were exported. However, the PPRM does use the ID as a reference in this kind of filter.

h3.Workaround

Enter Edit mode and manually set the proper page in the "With parent" field to fix the issue.

Another suggestion would be using the "Page properties ID (optional)" field instead of the "With parent" filter. Please note, the user would need to individually set an ID for each of the existing Page Properties macros in the child pages.
fields.summary: Page properties report macro loses reference to the page set at the "With parent" filter after importing a space from XML

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Jackson files in Confluence are out of date. While Confluence does not employ methodology which would enable exploitation of these old vulnerabilities, the problem is with the vulnerable files existing on the file system at all.
 * <confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache/felix/felix-cache/bundle141/version0.0/atlassian-gadgets-directory-plugin-4.2.14.jar-embedded/META-INF/lib/jackson-core-asl-1.4.4.jar
 * <confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache/felix/felix-cache/bundle141/version0.0/atlassian-gadgets-directory-plugin-4.2.14.jar-embedded/META-INF/lib/jackson-mapper-asl-1.4.3.jar
 * <confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache/felix/felix-cache/bundle248/version0.0/bundle.jar-embedded/META-INF/lib/jackson-annotations-2.5.0.jar
 * <confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache/felix/felix-cache/bundle248/version0.0/bundle.jar-embedded/META-INF/lib/jackson-core-2.5.4.jar
 * <confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache/felix/felix-cache/bundle248/version0.0/bundle.jar-embedded/META-INF/lib/jackson-databind-2.5.4.jar
 * <confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/jackson-core-asl-1.9.13-atlassian-1.jar
 * <confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/jackson-mapper-asl-1.9.13-atlassian-1.jar
 * <confluence-install>/synchrony-proxy/WEB-INF/lib/jackson-annotations-2.7.0.jar
 * <confluence-install>/synchrony-proxy/WEB-INF/lib/jackson-core-2.7.6.jar
 * <confluence-install>/synchrony-proxy/WEB-INF/lib/jackson-databind-2.7.6.jar

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the Jackson* files to the latest in the next release of Confluence.
fields.summary: Update old Jackson* files

Users would like to be able to set a separate homepage for Anonymous users than from Confluence licensed users.

fields.description:
I want to be able to search for macros right after clicking on the plus sign. 

For example, I use the Expand macro a lot. This takes a click, moving the mouse down, a click, a type, and a click.
I'd rather click, type, and click to save a couple seconds each time.

Current experience:
1. Click the plus sign for macros.
2. Move the mouse down and click on Other macros.
3. Type expand.
4. Click on Expand macro.

Desired experience:
1. Click the plus sign for macros.
2. Type expand.
3. Click on Expand macro.

h2. Use case
Some organizations have publicly-facing instances of Confluence with a select number of publicly accessible pages. This pages may be read-only and/or contain generally static content for informational purposes.

In this use case, "Discover" section on the side bar of the dashboard, which contains the "All updates" and "Popular" subsections, are not relevant.

Some organizations have requested an option in Confluence to hide this section for users accessing Confluence anonymously from the Dashboard.

h3. Problem Definition
In the Popular Content tab on the Confluence sidebar, it appears to display the most popular content from the last week. However, this isn't documented on our [Likes and Popular Content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/likes-and-popular-content-278695530.html] documentation, nor is this changeable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to change the default time fame of the macro and document this.

h3. Why this is important
Helps clear up confusion if some content appears to be missing, especially if there has been no use of Confluence since the last week.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a profile picture macro from a page (view mode)
# Paste into editor of another page
# Publish

h4. Behavior
Depending on where it was copied from (i.e. page with other user mentions, profile picture macros), it sometimes shows the wrong user pop up when you hover over it. Looking at the storage format, it doesn't seem to convert properly to a profile picture macro and turns into something more like an image with a link attached to it. Seems like it retains the user-link attribute from the old page  and if another user mentioned on the current page already has that user-link id, it will show that user in the pop-up.

However, only 10 users are listed per page. Even if we click *Check All*, only the current page is selected. In order to add a big list of users to a group, we would need to repeat this process several times, which seems a task that could be improved.

This is a request to increase the number of users listed in each User Picker page or at least give the possibility to actually select *ALL* users returned from the search.

fields.description:
Currently, if a disabled user tries to login, they get a generic error message.

Then they try again, ussually a few times. And then they unsuccessfully try to recover their password. And only after that do they contact us, with an urgent non-specific request for help, or even generate a duplicate account. 

Disabled users are effectively "shadow-banned". If they knew they were disabled, they could contact the admins and get help earlier.

We are using Wittified's "User Limit Manager", and users are disabled after a a year of inactivity. Some do still return, and then they get this issue.
fields.summary: Notify disabled user trying to login

fields.description:
Corresponding JIRA Server suggestion: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66465

Add a toggle in administration to underline hyperlinks. You've made a decision not to underline hyperlinks by default but requiring CSS modification is unnecessary and deters organizations from making pages accessible.

Every single set of web accessibility guidelines including WCAG 2.0 calls for underlined links. One of the many accessibility reasons to underline links is that many users can't differentiate certain colors (and Confluence's link color is very close to its text color). You should reverse the design decision but if you will not I think you should at least include a toggle as an accessibility feature.
fields.summary: Toggle to Underline Hyperlinks for Accessibility

fields.description:
Currently Confluence Server 6.5 distorts quality of avatars for Users and Spaces. Here are comparison screenshots of JIRA Server 7.4.0 and Confluence 6.5 taken on a standard definition display: 
||Jira Server 7.4.0||Confluence Server 6.5||
|!image-2017-12-11-13-57-36-104.png!|!image-2017-12-11-13-57-02-255.png|thumbnail!|
|!image-2017-12-11-14-00-18-664.png!|!image-2017-12-11-14-00-39-833.png!|

(flag) This happens on standard definition displays. This is _not_ related to other requests for HD, Retina, or 4K image quality.

(flag) Distortion occurs regardless of user input. The same file in .png or .jpg/.jpeg format will appear the same way, with or without anti-aliasing and with or without transparent pixels. (Confluence does not accept .svg format as JIRA does.)
fields.summary: Remove Avatar Compression for Spaces and Users

fields.description:
There are several authentication methods for PostgreSQL( [PostgreSQL 9.6.6 Documentation Chapter 20. Client Authentication|https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/static/auth-methods.html]	 but Confluence requires a username and password per the setup doc: [Database Setup for PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-postgresql-173244522.html]

The user and password info is stored on the file system in either server.xml (datasource) or confluence.cfg.xml (direct JDBC) which is not ideal for some of our customers.
fields.summary: Provide support for PostgreSQL authentication other than password based

fields.description: h3. Summary Special characters are not rendered correctly when they are present in Epic Name column of Jira Issues Macro. h3. Steps to Reproduce 1. In page confluence add Jira macro 2. in Jira Macro add the Epic name Column (Epic Name should include characters like 'ç', 'õ', 'á' ...) 3. Save Jira issues macro for confluence page h3. Expected Results Epic name text is rendered correctly: !Screen Shot 2017-12-13 at 5.52.56 PM.png|thumbnail! h3. Actual Results In view mode of the Confluence page the Jira issue macro show epic name column with an encoding problem: !Screen Shot 2017-12-13 at 5.54.36 PM.png|thumbnail! h3. Notes When analysing the browser developers tool content, we notice that the both the response and preview from */rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/clientIds* call has the data correctly encoded: * Response: {code} \\u003ca href\\u003d\\\"http://quicksilver/jira/browse/GHS-30?src\\u003dconfmacro\\\"\\u003e\\n solicitações de usuários\\n \\u003c/a\\u003e\\n {code} * Preview from /rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/clientIds: {code} class="icon" />↵ …src=confmacro">↵ solicitações de usuários↵ {code} Which means that only the rendering process of JIM is breaking the encoding. h3.Workaround # Sort table by clicking on any column name (obs.: */rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/renderTable* is called) # Reduce columns to display to key, summary and epic name Both workarounds result in the correct rendering of the special characters: !Screen Shot 2017-12-13 at 5.58.37 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA issues Macro error encoding UTF-8 to "Epic name" with special character

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you try to view a restricted page/space while accessing the site as an anonymous user, the site will prompt you to login on a pop-up menu. After keying in your credentials to login to the site, it throws an error message that says:
{quote}Oops! Something went wrong. It's probably us, but it might be you. Check your network connection.{quote}

Video of issue replication: [^IMG_1914.MOV] 

h3. Steps to replicate
 # Grant anonymous access to the Confluence site.
 # Grant anonymous access to a space.
 # Create a page in the space and add a link to a page from a restricted space (i.e. a space where anonymous users can't access).
 # Access Confluence on Safari on an iPhone and navigate to the page from step #3.
 # Click on the link in the page.
 # Enter your login credentials when prompted.

h3. Expected results
User is successfully logged in and can view the page if he has the necessary permissions.
  
h3. Actual results
The page loads for awhile and the user sees this error message:

 !IMG_1916.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Use Google Chrome browser on the iOS device.
* Switch from Mobile view to Desktop view and login.
fields.summary: Can't login to Confluence on iOS Safari using mobile view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Allow a mechanism (API) to disable/suppress email notifications on page creations.

h3. Notes
I have a plugin called Blog Tools for Confluence. which intercepts Page Templates and converts then to Blog Posts.

With you new architecture in Confluenc 5.10, I had to re-write my code, (see  DEVHELP-137). 

Customers are now complaining that they get 2 emails, one from the original Page creation, and one from the Blog Post my plugin creates (and deletes the Original Page). I was forced to do this because you guys removed the CreatePageTemplate listener !!!!!!!

So, how can I suppress the emails being sent from the Page creation, before my plugin kicks in?

I am getting multiple customers complain. P.S. The email notification from the Page Creation has broken links, since I delete the page. Customers don't like this.
fields.summary: Disable Email Notifications on Page Creation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Collaborative Editing does not work correctly when using Internet Explorer (IE). IE selects first option of character selection automatically when 2 users are editing the same page

h3. Environment
* Both user A & B use Internet Explorer 11.64.16299.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Both users edit a page
# User A types in non-English character (Chinese/Korean) for 10 sec
# Characters come out as expected
# User A continues to type 
# User B joins in typing in new line (Example: Test test test test)
# User A characters are not inserted correctly as it select the first option all the time

h3. Expected Results
Both users characters are selected and inputting correctly as expected.

h3. Actual Results
User A is not able to type correctly due to being selected first option of character selection. 
Video recorded: 
 [^non-english input.mp4] 
 
h3. Notes
Logs did not record any error. 

h3.Workaround
# Turn off Collaborative editing
#* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-collaborative-editing-858772086.html
# Use another browser. Chrome and Firefox works
fields.summary: Collabrative Editing for IE does not work correctly when inputting non-English characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

From chrome browser under Japanese IME environment, the first Japanese letter is duplicated when the next one is typed in an inline comment of Confluence page.
h3. Environment

Chrome browser under Microsoft Japanese IME or Google Japanese IME.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the inline comment.
 !Chrome Step1.png|thumbnail!
 #  Hit the Backspace key first.
 !Chrome Step2.png|thumbnail!
 #  Type an alphabet letter in Japanese IME mode.
 Let's use "a" here. (This shall be converted to "あ" by the Japanese IME) 
 !Chrome Step3.png|thumbnail!
 # Type an alphabet letter in Japanese IME mode one more time.
 Let's use "a" here again. (This shall be converted to "あ" by the Japanese IME)

h3. Expected Results

The expected result of the Step 3 and 4 is "ああ". (equivalent to "aa")
h3. Actual Results

The actual result of the Step3 and 4 is "あああ". (equivalent to "aaa")
 The first letter is duplicated as "aa".
 !Chrome Step4.png|thumbnail!

h3. Note
This occurs on the inline comment to an attached pdf file as well.
 !Chrome_with_pdf_Comment.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Workaround

Two workarounds.
 * Delete the affected letter with backspace and type the correct texts.
 * Use alternative browser to chrome.
fields.summary: First Japanese letter duplicated when next one typed in inline comment of Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you create an instance of the No Format macro on a page and do not populate it with any content, you can not subsequently edit the macro to add content.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.3.1, 6.3.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit a page.
# Add a No Format macro, but do not populate any content within it.
# Save the page.
# Edit the page and try to update the contents within the macro.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to add content within the body of the macro.

h3. Actual Results
You can not add any content within the body of the macro. 
 
h3.Workaround
There are two possible workarounds:
# Delete the No Format macro that has no content and readd with content.

...or...

# Edit the No Format macro that has no content and toggle the "No Panel" option and Save.
# Now, you should be able to add content to the macro.
fields.summary: Can not add content to No Format macro if it was created with no content

fields.description:
h3.Environment
* Team Calendars 5.3.19

h3.Issues (and solutions)
*The event type field requires the user to scroll up and down to select the event type they want to add* 
When I do this using Internet Explorer and the JAWS Screen Reading program, the event types available are not announced as I navigate through them. 

There are two solutions to this: either (1) allow the user to type in the event type they want since this field is a text box, or (2) use a dropdown so that when the user arrows up or down, they hear the types of events they can select.

*The beginning and end dates for adding events are a real issue*
When the user lands on one of the date fields, a calendar is displayed and they have to click on a date they want. With JAWS/IE, there is no way to select a different month other than the one you're in. For example, I was trying to add an event in December. While I could, with considerable effort, find the days of the month in November, I couldn't switch into December. 

This calendar interface is, for all practical purposes, completely inaccessible, and it doesn't have to be. Websites such as Amtrak.com have found ways to work around this. 

My solution to this problem would be to allow the user to type in the beginning and end dates since the fields are text boxes, telling them they need to type them in day-month-year (26-Dec-2017). I've tried typing into the text boxes and while the numbers I type will take, the dashes and letters for the month will not. They could also make the calendar keyboard accessible and tell the user how to open it and access the information they need.

*All of the fields need labels on them*
When the user tabs through fields, they'll be able to hear what each one is. My work-around is to memorize the order of the fields.
fields.summary: Accessibility issues with Team Calendars
